creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: bust of a male figure, leaning slightly forward, with a large nose and heavily shaded brow; tall, furry hat; light shading on shoulder
marks: in graphite on verso: L a/c | 276 | APG 9349 |
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until May 7, 1988; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Head of an Old Man in High Fur Cap: Bust
